Joe DSCEngine is a minimalistic, exogenously collateralized stablecoin system, designed to maintain a 1 token to \\$1 peg at all times. It is algorithmically stable and dollar-pegged, drawing parallels with DAI, but with distinct differences - DSCEngine operates without governance, fees, and is backed solely by WETH and WBTC.","kind":"dev","methods":{"constructor":{"details":"Initializes the contract with a set of token addresses, price feed addresses and the DSC contract address. constructor.details: Initializes the contract with a set of token addresses, price feed addresses and the DSC contract address. The length of the `tokenAddresses` and `priceFeedAddresses` must be identical as each token corresponds to a price feed. The price feeds are expected to provide prices in USD for each token, e.g., ETH/USD, MKR/USD.

params.dscAddress: The address of the DSC contract.
params.priceFeedAddresses: An array of addresses of the price feed contracts corresponding to each token.
params.tokenAddresses: An array of addresses of the tokens to be handled by the contract.

depositCollateral(address,uint256).details: Allows a user to deposit a specified amount of collateral into the contract.

params.amountCollateral: The amount of collateral being deposited.
params.tokenCollateralAddress: The ERC20 token address of the collateral being deposited.

params.amountDscToMint: The amount of DSC you want to mint.

constructor.notice: Constructor function for the DecentralizedStableCoin Engine.

depositCollateral(address,uint256).notice: Deposit collateral into the Decentralized Stablecoin Engine.

mintDsc(uint256).notice: You can only mint DSC if you have enough collateral.

documentation.text: @dev Mapping of token address to price feed address
@dev Amount of collateral deposited by user
@dev Amount of DSC minted by user
@dev If we know exactly how many tokens we have, we could make this immutable!

@notice Reverts if the user's health factor is below the minimum health factor.
 @param user The address of the user to check.
